summary: The Intelligence Community Property Security Act of 2025 amends the National Security Act of 1947 to penalize unauthorized access to intelligence community property. It defines unlawful access as accessing property under the jurisdiction of an intelligence community element that is clearly marked as closed or restricted. Penalties escalate with repeat offenses, ranging from fines and up to 180 days imprisonment for the first offense, to fines and up to 10 years imprisonment for the third or subsequent offense.
